reviewText: As a Naruto fan, this pleased me in various ways. It's a solid and fun fighting game that you can play locally with friends, or take the brawl online. It looks stunning thanks to the graphical revamp that came with Full Burst. Single Player mode also lets you catch up on the story and experience it hands on with massive battles that'll keep you at the edge of your seat(or couch in my case). Can't forget to mention how happy I am to see the series test the waters on the PC platform. This game is a must buy to all Naruto and anime fans alike, and those who love fighting games.

reviewText:
It's an odd feeling enjoying a game only until you get good at it. The main fighting part of the game becomes repedetive quite quickly as the AI demands you pull no punches and rely on the same unblockable moves and counters in order to progress. The re-imagined scenes from the anime are spot on and the animations (on the most part) are smooth and responsive while actually playing the game.

It's not a perfect game by far but, for me at least, it was well worth it's sale price... I'm afraid I didnt have the time or inclination to try its online vs options so I can't comment on that.

7/10

reviewText:
Story: The story mode was as in the second game, very well done. The scenes are well made, good music, animation, synochronisation (I am talking about the japanese one), and so on. Most of them are even better done than in the anime. There are cutscenes that last over half an hour, one even an hour. That did not bother me at all, as there was nothing important cut from the story. I have spent over 30 hours just on the story mode, completing 100%. Also, there are nicely done encounters, conversations and so on.

Graphics: No real improvement except in the cutscenes.

Gameplay: I am disappointed in this category. There were no real improvements over Generations, The amounts of melee combos has even been reduced to  3 instead of the known 4, even with characters that had 4 already. And it looks like the Free battle mode has simply been forgotten. You cannot adjust anything in the free combat exept time and difficulty, despite there already beeing so called condition fights"
recommended: meaning you cannot configure a fight with the fighters and conditions you choose. This is a extreme waste
hoursPlayed: because programming fights with chooseable conditions and fighters into the game should be pretty easy. It looks to me as if the programmers simply forgot.\nAlso

reviewText: As a Naruto fan, this pleased me in various ways. It's a solid and fun fighting game that you can play locally with friends, or take the brawl online. It looks stunning thanks to the graphical revamp that came with Full Burst. Single Player mode also lets you catch up on the story and experience it hands on with massive battles that'll keep you at the edge of your seat(or couch in my case). Can't forget to mention how happy I am to see the series test the waters on the PC platform. This game is a must buy to all Naruto and anime fans alike, and those who love fighting games.

reviewText:
The name of the game is long winded, overly prefixed and suffixed. Whether the title is for some actual specification they might need in the documentation of Naruto story arcs, or just comedic genious, i'm not sure.

The GAME itself is less convoluted. Its a very smooth flowing back and forth fighting mechanic thats pretty damn addictive, but also with the potential to get quite stale quite quickly depending on how you like your beat 'em ups. Theres a kind of beauty to the simplicity thats just gotten better throughout the Ultimate Ninja Storm series.

The story is a highly emotional and powerful tool designed to pull on your heartstrings to concern you and have you caring about the ambitions and actions of each the characters featured. This can, for some, become a very cheesy and overly dramatic sequence of problems no one really gives a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ about THAT much. I found myself facepalming and shaking my head at a lot of the high octane emotional overloads" But those going through the story can expect a HUGE display of theatric and overwhelming chaos and action
date: which evens out the amount of sappy stuff and plays into the gameplay very nicely.\n\nWhen all is said and done

reviewText:
I really wasn't expecting much from this game I only have it because a friend gave it to me and I felt obligated to play it, but I'm glad I did because the game is actually a lot of fun.

I don't like the anime, so I really don't think I have any kind of bias supporting it at all. This is probably why I am getting sick of the story mode right now since the cut-scenes can drag on for quite a while and I found myself skipping them a lot when I got the general jist of what the scene was about (sometimes even before that) and I would sometimes lose the context of a curtain fight.

But this IS a fighting game so the story isn't important what is important is the fighting system and I really like it. It's quite unique from other fighting games I've played and still manages to keep a kind of easy to learn
date: hard to master" element.\n\nMost of the characters are pretty ballenced
recommended: except for the ones that have very fast acting far-ranged moves (like the exploding birds from what-his-face) that make fighting them with another character a real chore when it requires a lot more skill to beat someone who's just spamming the X button all day that is just as strong as special attacks
hoursPlayed: but doesn't use any energy for some reason.\n\nI wish the game had a few more options though

reviewText: Regardless of how you may feel about the Naruto franchise, this is a solid fighting game with a decent story. Combat is fast, impactful and easy to learn, with lots of variation in other aspects. If you're not a Naruto fan you'd be forgiven for giving this a miss, but if you don't care one way or another, this is worth picking up.

reviewText:
Naruto is meh.
Modern fighting games are meh.
Modern Bandai Namco is meh.
Super-imposed Japanese stuff is meh.

BUT THIS GAME.
Not meh.
Actually pretty good.
Really good.
Had some slow down issues, but I tweaked the graphics settings and it runs like a dream.

Good fighting system. :)

(Storyline sucks so far though, tbh.)

EDIT:
Storyline still sucks. I want to watch the story, but not in 50 minute incriments with no way to save your progress in the cutscenes. Honestly, this is the only horrendous thing about the game. Everything else works decently well, but my gosh, if the cutscenes were any longer I think I would just pass out from exhaustion.

EDIT: Literally, sat there, playing the story mode for about 2 hours straight without a single save point. I have human needs. Like walking, breathing, and living.

reviewText: I bought the game DESPITE reading several reviews about how it's a bad port. At first I saw instantly what people were talking about. The game does NOT come with a default keyboard config. I do not know how a game can be released in 2014 without a default config. That essentially means if you tried to instantly hop in a match, no controls will work. Let's also not forget the config diagram that's supposed to help you map out your controls is a diagram of a XBOX controller... yet the game is made for PC. If that's not a sign of a bad port, I don't know what is. HOWEVER, once you map out a decent config on keyboard, the game isn't that bad. The only other issue I have is the framerate being locked at 30 FPS I believe. The other issue being the fact that for some reason, I can't go into full screen mode on this game, while every other game does it fine. Overall, this coming from a naruto fan of 8 years... 6.5/10
